skill.name: doc-coauthoring
skill.description: Guide users through a structured workflow for co-authoring documentation. Use when user wants to write documentation, proposals, technical specs, decision docs, or similar structured content. This workflow helps users efficiently transfer context, refine content through iteration, and verify the doc works for readers. Trigger when user mentions writing docs, creating proposals, drafting specs, or similar documentation tasks.
skill.summary: Guide users through a structured workflow for co-authoring documentation. Use when user wants to wri...

security_audit.summary: Official skill from a trusted source. No security review required beyond basic file scan. No risky patterns were observed.

content.value_statement: Writing docs takes time when context is scattered. This skill guides you through structured co-authoring so the document becomes clear, complete, and reader-ready.
actual_capabilities: Asks structured context questions about doc type, audience, impact, and constraints
Suggests section structures based on document type and template needs
Creates a draft scaffold with section placeholders for iterative filling
Iterates on sections using curated brainstorm options and targeted edits
Guides reader testing with questions and feedback loops for clarity gaps
limitations: Requires the user to provide context and source material
Cannot access external documents without available integrations or user-provided text
Reader testing with sub-agents depends on platform support
Does not verify factual accuracy or external links

use_cases.title: Draft a clear PRD
use_cases.description: Guide a PRD from context gathering through section drafting and reader testing.

use_cases.title: Write a technical spec
use_cases.description: Structure a spec, refine key sections, and validate that assumptions are clear.

use_cases.title: Create a decision doc
use_cases.description: Capture context, options, and rationale in a consistent decision document.

prompt_templates.title: Start a doc
prompt_templates.scenario: I need a new document but no outline yet
prompt_templates.prompt: Help me co-author a technical spec. Ask the initial context questions and propose a section structure.

prompt_templates.title: Refine a section
prompt_templates.scenario: I have a rough outline for a PRD
prompt_templates.prompt: Use the workflow to draft the technical approach section. Ask questions, brainstorm options, then draft.

prompt_templates.title: Iterate with edits
prompt_templates.scenario: I want targeted improvements to a section
prompt_templates.prompt: Review this section and suggest concise edits. Focus on clarity, trade-offs, and reader assumptions.

prompt_templates.title: Run reader testing
prompt_templates.prompt: Perform reader testing on this document and report gaps or ambiguities. Then suggest fixes.

output_examples.input: Help me write a decision doc for adopting a new logging platform.
output: Asked for audience, impact, and required format
Proposed sections: Context, Options, Decision, Rationale, Risks, Rollout
Drafted Context and Options after targeted questions
Outlined reader testing steps to validate clarity

best_practices: Answer context questions with concise, concrete details
Confirm section structure before drafting content
Use reader testing to surface hidden assumptions
anti_patterns: Skipping context gathering and forcing a draft
Editing the document directly without feedback cues
Ignoring reader testing feedback on ambiguities

faq.question: What platforms is this skill compatible with?
faq.answer: It works in Codex and Claude. Claude Code support improves reader testing with sub-agents.

faq.question: What are the usage limits?
faq.answer: Limits depend on your platform plan and tool access. Large documents may need multiple iterations.

faq.question: Can it integrate with Google Docs or Slack?
faq.answer: Yes if integrations are enabled. Otherwise you must paste the content manually.

faq.question: Is my data stored or shared?
faq.answer: Data handling depends on your platform policies. Provide only information you are permitted to share.

faq.question: What if the draft feels generic?
faq.answer: Provide more context and request targeted edits. The workflow improves with specific guidance.

faq.question: How does this compare to freeform writing?
faq.answer: This adds structure, iterative refinement, and reader testing. Freeform is faster but less consistent.
